arm_group.description: Each participant will receive two lidocaine injections on the abdomen with different pH

brief_summary.textblock:
This study will investigate the influence of adjusting the pH of lidocaine on pain during
      subcutaneous injection. Each participant will receive two injections on the abdomen with
      different pH. After each injection, the subject will be asked to evaluate the pain on a
      Visual analog scale (0-100 mm). It is anticipated that the pain decreases with increasing
      pH. The aim of the study is to find a simple method for pain reduction that can be used in
      clinical practice.

clinical_study.brief_title: Will Adjusting the pH of Lidocaine Reduce the Pain During Injection of Local Anaesthetic?

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria: fyll inn

          -  Age 18-65 years

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Kidney, heart or liver disease

          -  Eczema or psoriasis on injection site

          -  Neuropathy

          -  Regular use of painkillers

          -  Hypersensitivity of Lidocaine

          -  Pregnancy

          -  Diabetes

clinical_study.official_title: Will Adjusting the pH of Lidocaine Reduce the Pain During Injection of Local Anaesthetic?

overall_official.affiliation: Norwegian University of Science and Technology
